title: 2012 Soil Health Info Day: "Residue Soil Structure and Cover Crops" with Paul Jasa

subtasks: Highlighting the benefits of residue protection and soil structure
Discussing the effects of tillage on soil compaction and structure
Explaining the importance of soil biological life in water management and erosion control
Describing the role of cover crops in building soil organic matter and managing nutrients
Recommending strategies for optimal residue management and minimizing evaporation
Highlighting the impact of long-term no-till on soil moisture retention and crop yield
Emphasizing the value of rotational crops and the use of perennial grasses for soil health
Identifying treatment of compaction layers through alternative methods, such as strip tilling
Discussing the cycling of nutrients and organic matter within the residue-covered soil
Presenting data on evaporation reduction and water infiltration improvement due to residue and cover crops
Discussing the compatibility of cover crops with organic weed control and the role in pest management
Recommending the selection and management of cover crops based on desired outcomes and local climate.
